intro: Streblina denticulata, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is often found in forest understories. The leaves contain irritant chemicals that can cause skin irritation upon contact.
